Lack of diversity ‘heartbreaking’

Actor Halle Berry says she had once believed that she paved the way for diversity in the Academy Awards when she bagged the Best Actress Award in 2002. The 49-year-old, who won the award for Monster’s Ball , says it is heartbreaking that no other woman of colour has received the award in that category since then.

She said: “I believed that in that moment, that when I said in my acceptance speech, ‘The door tonight has been opened’, I believed that with every bone in my body that this was going to incite change because this door, this barrier, had been broken... And to sit here almost 15 years later, and knowing that another woman of colour has not walked through that door, is heartbreaking.” — IANS
title: Halle Berry thought she paved way for diversity at Oscars
